intro: Festuca duriuscula f. tanarii, commonly known as the Tanarii fescue, is a botanical variant of the tall fescue species. It is a perennial grass characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and fine, blue-green foliage. This variety is well adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. It is often used in landscaping and erosion control due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal. The plant is also valued for its ability to withstand drought and moderate grazing.
